name: CircuitLab
headline: Online circuit simulator and electronic schematic editor.
description: CircuitLab makes it easier for electrical engineers, students, and electronics hobbyists to design, analyze, build, and share electronic circuits.

#  Circuit simulation and schematics. 
## Build and simulate circuits right in your browser.
  * Design with our easy-to-use schematic editor.
  * Analog & digital circuit simulations in seconds.
  * Professional schematic PDFs, wiring diagrams, and plots.
  * No installation required! Launch it _instantly_ with [one click](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/7pq5wm/?from=homepage>).

[ Launch CircuitLab ](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/7pq5wm/?from=homepage>)
_or watch a quick demo video_ → 
[![](https://cdn.circuitlab.com/misc/20170112-UltimateElectronicsBookCover_red_v2.jpg)](https://www.circuitlab.com/<https:/ultimateelectronicsbook.com/>)
###  Interactive Electronics Textbook New!
Master the analysis and design of electronic systems with CircuitLab's free, interactive, online electronics textbook. 
Open: [**Ultimate Electronics: Practical Circuit Design and Analysis**](https://www.circuitlab.com/<https:/ultimateelectronicsbook.com/>)
###  [ Electronics Questions and Answers ](https://www.circuitlab.com/</questions/>)

[Browse More Questions](https://www.circuitlab.com/</questions/>) • [Ask Your Own](https://www.circuitlab.com/</questions/ask/>) • [Contribute an Answer](https://www.circuitlab.com/</questions/>)
# Examples
  * [555 Timer as Oscillator](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/e38756/>) / [PWM Generator](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/z242cn/>)
  * [7805 & Wall-wart Experiencing Voltage Drop-out](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/4j8yb7/>)
  * [BJT audio amplifier](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/6syafk/>)
  * [BJT Cascoded Active-load Diff. Amp. with CMFB](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/fby849/>)
  * [BJT current mirror](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/7f7ge4/>)
  * [Digital 4-bit counter and DAC](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/53xa3r/>)
  * [Diode half-wave rectifier](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/4da864/>)
  * [Diode full-wave (bridge) rectifier](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/f6ex5x/>)
  * [Diode turn-off time](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/fwr26m/>)
  * [Laplace transform step response and Bode plot](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/5gcrpn/>)
  * [LED with resistor biasing](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/z79rqm/>)
  * [JFET-based electret microphone amplifier](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/w88e3e/>)
  * [Mechanical spring dashpot Laplace model](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/d6749d/>)
  * [MOSFET and resistor NAND](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/42475b/>) / [NOR gate](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/zjc468/>)
  * [MOSFET (CMOS) NAND](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/592d96/>) / [NOR gate](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/kzw5km/>)
  * [MOSFET switching inductive load](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/t67g8z/>)
  * [Op-Amp inverting](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/bkg2qg/>) / [non-inverting amplifier](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/me84mf/>)
  * [RC vs. RL step response](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/r586j5txhufk/>) / [frequency response](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/vr2qz6p4k643/>)
  * [RLC resonance](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/wt3nym/>)
  * [Resistors in series and parallel](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/g2qzxs/>)
  * [Zener diode voltage reference](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/7f3ndq/>)
  * [_more examples in "Ultimate Electronics" book..._](https://www.circuitlab.com/<https:/ultimateelectronicsbook.com/>)


![Common-sense schematics \(automatic voltage source\) screenshot](https://www.circuitlab.com/assets/images/homepage_schem_ss6.png)
**Common sense schematics** let you name a node "+5V" and know that the simulator will do the right thing automatically, keeping your schematics compact and elegant. 
![Build box screenshot](https://www.circuitlab.com/assets/images/homepage_schem_ss7.png)
**Quick-access build box** lets you draw basic circuit primitives quickly, while allowing access to a wide assortment of non-linear elements, feedback elements, digital / mixed-mode components, and custom drawing tools. 
### Easy-to-use Power Tools
**Easy-wire mode** lets you connect elements with fewer clicks and less frustration. 
**Cross-window copy/paste** lets you easily explore and re-mix parts of public circuits from the CircuitLab community. 
![Easy-wire mode screenshot](https://www.circuitlab.com/assets/images/homepage_schem_ss1.png)
**Mixed-mode circuit simulation** lets you simulate analog and digital components side-by-side. 
**SPICE-like component models** give you accurate results for nonlinear circuit effects. 
![Mixed-mode circuit simulation screenshot](https://www.circuitlab.com/assets/images/homepage_schem_ss2.png)
**Human-friendly formats** let you enter and display values concisely, just like you would on a paper schematic. 
**Unit-aware expression evaluation** lets you plot arbitrary signals of interest, such as differential signals or power dissipation. 
![Human-friendly formats screenshot](https://www.circuitlab.com/assets/images/homepage_schem_ss3.png)
**In-browser simulation and plotting** lets you design and analyze faster, making sure your circuit works before ever picking up a soldering iron. 
**Unique circuit URLs** let you easily share your work or ask for help online. 
![Time-domain plotting screenshot](https://www.circuitlab.com/assets/images/homepage_schem_ss4.png)
**Advanced simulation capabilities** include frequency-domain (small signal) simulation, stepping circuit parameters through a range, arbitrary Laplace transfer function blocks, and more. 
![Frequency-domain parameter sweep screenshot](https://www.circuitlab.com/assets/images/homepage_schem_ss5.png)
“Give it a try – this is a great idea.”
![EDN](https://www.circuitlab.com/assets/images/tinylogo_edn_aaa.png)
“Amazingly user friendly and simple for even the novice hobbyist to dive into.”
![Engadget](https://www.circuitlab.com/assets/images/tinylogo_engadget_aaa.png)
“Browser-based circuit simulator boasts a mountain of features.”
![Hackaday](https://www.circuitlab.com/assets/images/tinylogo_hackaday_aaa.png)
**“Smart Wires” Technology:** Build your schematic faster than ever before with our unique, intelligent Smart Wires technology for connecting terminals and rearranging components. 
![Smart Wires](https://cdn.circuitlab.com/misc/20131014-feature-smartwires.png)
![Proprietary CircuitLab simulation engine](https://cdn.circuitlab.com/misc/20131014-feature-simulationengine.png)
**Proprietary Simulation Engine:** An extended-precision numerical solver core plus an advanced mixed-mode event-driven simulation engine makes it easy to get simulations running quickly. 
**Presentation-Quality Schematics:** Print sharp, beautiful vector PDFs of your schematics, plus export to PNG, EPS, or SVG for including schematics in design documents or deliverables. 
![Presentation-quality schematics](https://cdn.circuitlab.com/misc/20131014-feature-exports.png)
![Plotting engine](https://cdn.circuitlab.com/misc/20131014-feature-plottingengine.png)
**Powerful Plotting Engine:** Work with multiple signals easily with configurable plotting windows, vertical and horizontal markers, and calculations on signals. Export plot images for inclusion in design documents. 
**Rapid Symbol Creation:** Draw generic rectangular symbols for IC or system-level wiring diagrams with just a few clicks. 
![Custom generic rectangular symbols](https://cdn.circuitlab.com/misc/20131014-feature-customrectangle.png)
![Behavioral sources and expressions](https://cdn.circuitlab.com/misc/20131014-feature-behavioral.png)
**Behavioral Sources & Expressions:** Experiment and iterate rapidly with programmable algebraic sources and expressions. [See documentation](https://www.circuitlab.com/</docs/expressions/>)
“ CircuitLab is the best editor I have ever used. Bug-free design, excellent simulation. Well done. No more using LTSpice. ”
— @yigitdemirag
“ In our product development cycle, we've used CircuitLab in more places than you might expect: optimizing our analog front-end, RF matching network analysis, improving our power supply robustness, and designing and documenting test and production fixtures. ”
— Pantelligent Hardware Engineering Team
[ Launch CircuitLab ](https://www.circuitlab.com/</editor/7pq5wm/?from=homepage>)

[Electronics Textbook](https://www.circuitlab.com/<https:/ultimateelectronicsbook.com/>) [Electronics Q&A](https://www.circuitlab.com/</questions/>) [Forums](https://www.circuitlab.com/</forums/>) [Blog](https://www.circuitlab.com/</blog/>)

![CircuitLab logo](https://www.circuitlab.com/assets/images/footer_logo_300_opacity25_2x.png)
CircuitLab provides online, in-browser tools for schematic capture and circuit simulation. These tools allow students, hobbyists, and professional engineers to design and analyze analog and digital systems before ever building a prototype. Online schematic capture lets hobbyists easily share and discuss their designs, while online circuit simulation allows for quick design iteration and accelerated learning about electronics. 
[Website monitoring by Heii On-Call.](https://www.circuitlab.com/<https:/heiioncall.com/?ref=circuitlab_footer>)

generated_description:
**CircuitLab: Your Go-To Online Circuit Simulator**

Founded in 2012 as part of Y Combinator’s W13 batch, CircuitLab has carved a niche in the online electronics design space. Located in Redwood City, CA, this nimble operation consists of just two dedicated team members, making it a quintessential startup—lean, focused, and innovative.

### What They Do

CircuitLab provides a powerful online platform for designing, analyzing, and sharing electronic circuits. It caters to electrical engineers, students, and electronics enthusiasts alike, enabling them to create schematics and run simulations right from their web browsers, no installation required. Here's a quick rundown of their features:

- **Intuitive Schematic Editor**: Users can easily design circuits with a user-friendly interface.
- **Circuit Simulation**: Both analog and digital circuits can be simulated in real time, presenting results in seconds.
- **Professional Outputs**: The platform generates high-quality schematic PDFs, wiring diagrams, and plots suitable for documentation and presentations.
- **Interactive Learning Resources**: CircuitLab offers an interactive electronics textbook, titled **Ultimate Electronics**, helping users grasp complex topics in a straightforward manner.

They also foster a community-oriented approach with a dedicated forum for **Electronics Q&A**, where users can ask questions and share knowledge.

### Unique Features

What sets CircuitLab apart from conventional circuit simulation tools is its emphasis on **accessibility** and **sharing**. Users can easily:
- Connect elements in their designs with fewer clicks thanks to their **Easy-wire mode**.
- Share their work through unique circuit URLs, making collaboration seamless.
- Access a diverse array of components, including SPICE-like models for accurate simulations of nonlinear effects.

These features contribute to an engaging environment that accelerates learning and design iteration, ensuring that users can validate their ideas without having to instinctively reach for a soldering iron.

### Impact and Recognition

Since its inception, CircuitLab has garnered praise for its intuitive design and extensive features. Publications like **EDN** and **Hackaday** have highlighted its user-friendliness and robust capabilities, earning a reputation as a solid tool for both novices and experienced engineers alike.

### Conclusion

In short, CircuitLab is not just a tool; it's a complete ecosystem for electronic design that emphasizes ease of use, community interaction, and innovation. For anyone looking to dive into the world of electronics, CircuitLab stands out as a go-to resource. You can get started [here](https://www.circuitlab.com/) and begin building your next project today!
